Problem.title: Meet Idir, a 16-year-old student in Morocco
Problem.subtitle: Like millions of students worldwide, Idir faces an impossible choice every day in class...

card1.title: Listen or Write?
card1.description: Focus on the teacher and miss important details, or frantically scribble notes and lose the explanation?

card2.title: Silent Confusion
card2.description: Questions pile up but there's never enough time to ask. The lesson moves on, leaving gaps in understanding.

card3.title: Memorize, Don't Understand
card3.description: Study sessions become cramming sessions. Information goes in one ear and out the other.

conclusion.description: This is the daily reality for students everywhere, from Morocco to Madagascar, from high school to university.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.subtitle: Everything you need to know about joining the waitlist

q1.question: When will Bundi Notes be available?
q1.answer: We're launching in Spring 2026. Waitlist members will get early access before the public launch, with beta testing opportunities starting in Fall 2025.

q2.question: Will it cost money?
q2.answer: Bundi Notes will have both free and premium tiers. Waitlist members get 50% off their first year and access to premium features during the early access period.

q3.question: What devices will it work on?
q3.answer: Bundi Notes will be available on web, iOS, and Android. We're designing it to work seamlessly across all your devices, so you can record on your phone and study on your laptop.

q4.question: How do I know this is real?
q4.answer: We're committed to transparency. Waitlist members receive regular development updates, behind-the-scenes content, and early previews of the product as we build it.

q5.question: What if I change my mind?
q5.answer: No problem at all! You can unsubscribe from the waitlist at any time. We respect your inbox and will never spam you.

q6.question: Will it work in my language?
q6.answer: We're starting with Arabic, English, French, Swahili, and Hausa, with plans to add more African languages based on community demand. Let us know what language you need!
